reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived on sun 14th sep first thought when i stepped outside was we could have picked a better place to stay. but gave it benefit of the doubt how wrong was I! we had several steps to climb with heavey cases then i wanted to flop on the bed but realised it was folded up we were sleeping on sofa bed all week the rooms were not cleaned as much as they should have been the furniture was old and out dated i did not think the rooms were clean when we arrived. i loved the view from balcony and size of the kitchen but did not use it. there was no good drinks to choose from i wouldnt call it a bar, the facilities were rubbish we played pool and even the pool table was broken and the pool outside was too small there was not enough sunbeds for every 1 the hotel was overrated and overpriced this is no way a 4 star.
reviews.title: bitterly dissapointed absolute hovel nat 24 aberdeen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were ok but not brilliant the location is ok but the steps 2 old town are a killer good thing was i did nt let it ruin my time in the algarve .
reviews.title: lovely holiday

reviews.text: We loved our time in Portugal.
reviews.title: Nice apartments, shame about location!

likes.disliked: — Location - opposite building site and barking dogs during the night!

reviews.text: We arrived at Cerro Malpique to a warm welcome form the man at reception who told us where all the local amenities were.
reviews.title: fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment were great and clean. I have given these apartment 4/5 this is because I felt that the bathrooms could do with updating.
reviews.title: Paradise in Portugal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a studio apartment here for 3 nights and wish I had just payed the extra money and stayed somewhere nicer! Where do I start!?
reviews.title: Horrible, Dirty and Dangerous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room that we were in looked absolutely nothing like the pictures provided, instead it was very old, tired and shabby. We had a double camping bed to sleep on as opposed to an actual double bed which was far from comfortable. The room was very dirty and if I were to guess the last time it had seen a lick of paint I'd say about 10 years ago.
reviews.title: a pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was dirt and grime around the bath and shower, our toilet was broken and so the cistern continually filled up until you turned it off manually. We plugged the laptop into one of the sockets and it sparked and switching the lights on and off in the lounge area made the light in the kitchen flash. Lights on the balcony didn't work either.
reviews.title: Lovely place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was by far the biggest disappointment. A glass had been smashed by the pool one evening so I let reception know so that they could have it swept up before some kid got it in their foot the next day. The receptionist took note and thanked me for letting her know but when we went up to the pool the next day the glass had simply been swept into a pile, no one had even bothered to lift it!
reviews.title: Be aware before booking!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know that you are likely to find a few dead bugs in an outdoor pool but this was just unbelievable, you couldn't swim from floating ants and other insects. There was clumps of hair floating at the sides and lots of leaves and cigarette ends at the bottom of the pool, it was absolutely filthy and I wouldn't have let my dog swim in it! I don't know when it was last cleaned but the overpowering smell of chlorine would suggest that instead of cleaning the pool they just throw in more chemicals!
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.text: The apartment was large and consisted of a lounge/ dining area with a sofa being utilised as two single beds (not tried). Furniture was functional and of a style of he area. Carpet could have done with some work though. Kitchen was large with dishwasher fridge cooker and utensils/pots/pottery for four.
reviews.title: excellent apartment, quiet area close to old town centre.
Great Place! maybe not for those immobile...
reviews.text: The bathroom was three piece and clean with a powerful shower over the bath. The bedroom looked out over the pool. Two single beds together - comfortable but rather low down (about a foot off the floor for those of you with back issues!).

reviews.title: Pretty Good
reviews.text: Massive wardrobe space in hall and bedroom. The apartment was cleaned of waste from the kitchen and bathroom daily, towels changed every couple of days, beds made a couple of times and the carpets swept once. Overall the apartment was kept clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked previously for a sea view and got it (most aparts' have them anyway (I was in room 502) and had a view over the old town, fishermans beach and the pool. Previous reports discussed the cleaning of the pool. There appeared to be a daily intake of blown leaves and I saw two daily cleaning rituals and overall it was clean. There was enough sun beds for all a couple of brollies extra would not be amiss though.
reviews.title: Great accommodation but phew those steps!

reviews.text: Very quiet unless kids having a good time in the pool but generally very quiet. The trip to the old town is down either of two long flights of steps (around 98 each) - these would be a definite problem for the infirm or elderly. The steps take you either directly into the old town square that wakes up around 20:00 hrs till whatever time in the a.m. - I was well asleep before 11:00 at night but assumed the night life was very busy. Only used the kitchen for making breakfast and sorely missed a kettle and toaster that was quoted in the agents pamphlet, my enquiry at reception was very negative (Sandra) as I pointed out that other apartments had these items she suggested I go and take the items from these rooms for myself. No effort was made to supply the equipment and I was most put out by the response. Similarly, prior to my arrival (some days before) I enquired both thro the agent and with a direct phone call to the aparthotel if the TV had either a scart or video input (I wanted to edit my video films) and told they are not available by both agent and hotel. Guess what, the TV in the room had both! Not impressed with reception staff at all, although Sandra did bring out the first aid kit when I injured my foot. The TV has one engish speaking channel the rest being foriegn. Never wathed it tho'.
reviews.title: You had better be fit!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all very last minute this trip! booked through alpharooms and was extremely pleased. Got upgraded to Cerro Malpique 2 and into a huge apartment. We had pretty much the run of the pool area as the place was quiet. Close to the old town and a pleasant stroll down. Come out on the road where The Cavern & O'Manjar are so a hearty meal and a drink and an insult from Pete in the Cavern are there if you want!! Would recommend and consider again anytime.
reviews.title: loved the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Handy for the old town and the steep st3eps down to town are good exercise. Loads of space in the apartment and it was well-equipped too. If you like be near the main attractions but have peace and quiet once you are back in your apartment this is the place for you. Only complaint is the bed was very hard but everything else was great. We had good service with towels changed alternate days and friendly helpful receptionist.
reviews.title: Good value and location and lots of space

reviews.text: If you get a ground floor apartment you may also be lucky enough to get a visit from the local friendly cat who is very fond of the sardine pate you get as a starter in a lot of the restaurants! we bought a tin especially and the cat turned up regularly for feeding and stroking!
reviews.title: fantastic - out of this world.

reviews.text: we were lucky and unknown to ourselves were booked into the Cerro Malpique 2 - which are new apartments. room was huge with a massive sun trap balcony. pool was basically our own!! hardly anybody about. lovely and quiet. walk to old town wasnt that bad - had about 20 steps then it was downhill all the way and only took less than 10 mins to walk. we loved the location in fact we got the card from the reception to stay again.
reviews.title: Very disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want top notch accomo then ask for number 2 - think when you book online its classed as superior accom.
reviews.title: Very disappointing & basic accomodation.
